It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Military commission order] 1842 Apr. 11, Memphis, Tennessee [to] James Jones / J.C. McMackin
bibl.author: McMackin, J.C.
bibl.note: This is a response to a military commission from J.C. McMackin in Memphis, Tennessee to governor James Jones in Nashville. McMackin requests the governor to commission and give the order for arms to be supplied to the 128th regiment volunteer company of troops he has raised.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

opener.add: To his Excellency James C. Jones Governor and Commander in Chief of the militia of the State of Tennessee__

div.p: after having authorized the raising a volunteer company in the 128 Reg Regiment __ J.M. in due form I have this day reviewed and received the same, under the denomination of the "Memphis Blues"

You will commission the same and give the order for their arms as provided by law. The certificate enclosed will give you the names of the officers entitled to commissions__ Given under my hand and seal at memphis this 11th day of april 1842
